</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the gunner of a vehicle. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[Object]] <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> '''gunner''' vehicle </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Object]] -  
The person sitting in the gunner place is returned. If vehicle is not a vehicle but a person, the person is returned. </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <ext><name>pre</name><attr/><inner>(gunner _tank1) action ["getout",_tank1]</inner><close></pre></close></ext> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[commander]], [[driver]], [[crew]], [[currentPilot]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 2 January, 2007 - 13:10
<dt class="note">[[User:UNN|UNN]]<dd class="note">
The [[gunner]] command will only return a single gunner. If the vehicle has occupied, multiple turrets. See this discussion on the official forums, for an alternative:

[http://www.flashpoint1985.com/cgi-bin/ikonboard311/ikonboard.cgi?s=a28320fa4c4e659219eac08ac65093aa;act=ST;f=71;t=56128 Need an array with a vehicle's cargo units]


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
